newsitem.title: VENEZUELA: Venezuela April imports rise 4.7 pct yr on yr.
newsitem.headline: Venezuela April imports rise 4.7 pct yr on yr.

text.p: The value of Venezuelan imports in April rose 4.7 percent, or $39.7 million, to $885 million compared to April last year, according to preliminary trade figures from the Central Office of Statistics and Information (OCEI).
The April figures took total imports over the first four months of the year to $3.198 billion, up 23.3 percent from the same period in 1996, the OCEI said.
Venezuelan trade figures are closely watched by analysts for signs of a recovery in domestic demand, as well as the effect of what many say is an overvalued bolivar.
OCEI did not provide April figures, but the private sector accounted for the vast majority of imports over the four months, with 85.5 percent of the total.
Electrical goods was the biggest category of imports with 31.3 percent of the four month total, then chemical products with 11.1 percent and base metals with 10.5 percent.
The United States was the top exporter to Venezuela with 47.2 percent, followed by Colombia with 5.1 percent, Brazil with five percent and Germany with 4.8 percent, the OCEI said
